result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
8:51 AM Defendant Drew David Geib appeared by video from the Ozaukee County Jail, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Kerra Stumbris in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews case history. Defendant advises put in request for PD evaluation. Defendant advises was revoked on probation. Clerk to send petition for Court appointed attorney if Defendant does not qualify for PD. Court finds good cause to extend time limits.
Status conference scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Status conference on November 14, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription. Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants. Not to leave the State of Wisconsin.

1:17 PM Defendant Drew David Geib appeared by video from the Ozaukee County Jail, in custody.  Attorney Heather Dvoran in court for Drew David Geib as a friend of the Court.  Prosecuting attorney Benjamin Lindsay in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant does not qualify for PD. Court advises of charges/penalties and finds probable cause. State recommends $5,000 cash bail w/conditions. Defendant is on PO hold. Counsel requests $250 cash bail. Court finds good cause to extend time limits and sets matter for status.
Status hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
